From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To switch the egress-span mode from the default mode (either centralized or distributed depending on your Cisco IOS software release), use the **monitor session egress replication-mode** command in global configuration mode. To return to the default mode, use the **no** form of the command.
CLIs: no monitor session egress replication-mode centralized
no monitor session egress replication-mode distributed

ParaDef.Info: **In Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXH2a and later releases**: Specifies centralized egress span monitoring as the default mode.
**In Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXH, SXH1, and SXH2**: Specifies distributed egress span monitoring as the default mode.

Examples: Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXH, SXH1, and SXH2
The following example shows how to switch the egress-span mode from the distributed default to centralized mode:
Router(config)# monitor session egress replication-mode centralized
The following example shows how to switch the egress-span mode from centralized back to distributed mode:
Router(config)# no monitor session egress replication-mode centralized
Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXH2a and Later Releases
The following example shows how to switch the egress-span mode from the centralized default to distributed mode:
Router(config)# monitor session egress replication-mode distributed
The following example shows how to switch the egress-span mode from distributed back to centralized mode:
Router(config)# no monitor session egress replication-mode distributed
ExtraInfo: ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Prior to Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXH and the introduction of this feature, the operating mode was centralized and could not be changed.---Centralized egress span monitoring redirects traffic to the supervisor engine for egress monitoring.Distributed egress span monitoring is performed in the ingress module. Distributed replication for Switched Port Analyzer (SPAN), Remote SPAN (RSPAN), and Encapsulated RSPAN (ERSPAN) increases the total throughput at the span destination.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Distributed egress span (DES) mode is applied to ASIC-based sessions only.---
